solution_line_template: If the ship traveled {day1_north} miles to the north, it sailed for a distance of {day2_multiplier} * {day1_north} miles = {day2_east} miles to the east on the second day.
On the third day, the sheep sailed for {day2_east} miles + {day3_extra} miles = <<{day2_east}+{day3_extra}={day3_east}>>{day3_east} miles.
The distance covered by the ship in the three days is {day3_east} miles + {day2_east} miles + {day1_north} miles = <<{day3_east}+{day2_east}+{day1_north}={total_distance}>>{total_distance} miles
